page.title: 02A Walk to the Day Mark.
page.content: A group of us set out from Dartmouth to walk to the Day Mark,which is a navigational beacon,built high on the hills,overlooking the mouth of the Dart.The hot sun was beating down on us as we started walking.We followed the Coastal Footpath to Mill Bay Cove where we did some sketching and looked at Castle boathouse.We went on,the sun still beating down on us.Herring gulls flew overhead,screeching and looking for food.At Inner Froward Point,we climbed up a path inland towards the Day Mark.It is a very tall stone structure,built in 1840,standing in a field of barley.We went over a stile and along a path until we were right underneath it.It stands on 8 strong legs and feels dark and mysterious inside.When we had made some sketches, and enjoyed a cool drink,we started our journey back to Dartmouth.
